p: Epidemiologic modeling of the 2013 chimpanzee respiratory epidemic yielded daily transmission rate estimates of 0.85, 0.44, and 0.62 (average 0.68) and duration of infection estimates of 1.6 days, 5.8 days, and 2.1 days (average 3.2 days) for the 3 phases of the epidemic. Together, these parameters equate to basic reproductive numbers ( R 0 values) of 1.38, 2.56, and 1.56 for the 3 phases of the epidemic, with an overall R 0 estimate of 1.83 ( Technical Appendix Figure 1).
